data.text:
Agile Transformation tools are essential for software/product development, project management, quality testing, and project delivery. These tools support various Agile methodologies, including Kanban, Scrum, SDLC, XP Development, and more. However, the Developers must know which tool is used for what and which features they have. Here we will discuss the standard Agile Tools that are popularly used by the Scrum Team, Development Team, and Software Testing Team. So, let’s get started!

Tools Used By Agile Teams

1. Jira

Jira is a comprehensive Agile project management tool with features such as fully-customizable Kanban boards, Scrum, Project Tracking, and Monitoring. Its customizable Scrum makes Sprint Planning easier for the Scrum Master. Project Managers can create customized organizational Kanban Boards to monitor the entire CI/CD pipeline through Jira. Also, administrators can easily generate burnout charts, velocity charts, workflow diagrams, and more. It’s unique JQL or Jira Query Language makes the development process easier for the Developers. So there is nothing to regret after investing in Jira for Agile project management.

2. Git

Git, the distributed source code version control tool from GitHub, is ideal for Developers working with a single central repository. This tool can track all changes made by Developers through different virtual systems. It is an incredible way to improve the Agile Continuous Integration procedure. This free tool also minimizes source code errors with better source code management.

3. Trello

The Agile Leader must start his project management journey with a Trello board, its lists, and cards. This tool comes with various customizable features to improve teamwork and collaboration, such as:

Timeline view to track the Product Goal

Shared team calendars for better time management

Table view for improving intra-team collaboration across boards

Dashboard See board stats to offer analytical insights

Trello makes it easier for the Scrum Team to align its Sprint Planning with the production team. From planning Daily Scrum to managing project goal setting, this tool is perfect for managing multiple projects from a single place.

4. Azure Boards

Microsoft Azure Boards can handle the entire software development and project delivery process. Azure DevOps Developers utilize the MS Azure Boards to plan, create, track, and manage the development and integration team’s day-to-day activities. Azure Boards come in handy while planning the Product Strategy - how to divide the workload among Development and Scrum Team to ensure on-time final product delivery work.

5. LeanKit

LeanKit is the ultimate Agile Transformation tool to implement Kanban Boards to track and monitor agile progress. It offers the following software features for the Product Owner and Project Manager:

Ready-to-use Kanban Board view templates

Dashboard to track workflow issues and bugs

Manage multiple project portfolios and activities

Lean analytics metrics and system reporting tools

Leankit is perfect for DevOps Developers to handle essential work items from a single place. It also promotes cross-functional team collaboration for Scrum.

6. Rally

Rally is one of the best Agile Tools available for efficient project management, offering the following features:

Monitor the production team’s progress with the “Team Status” check

Plan and handle User Stories to estimate the End Goal

Track the work progress of each User Story

Track Iteration Status to find defects

Rally is accessible from Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, etc., and runs on different Operating Systems, including Mac, Windows, and Linux.

7. Azure DevOps

Azure DevOps is the ultimate Project Planning Agile tool to support the Product Vision, offering the following services:

Azure Boards to plan, track, and update workflows across teams

Azure Pipelines to build and deploy code with CI/CD integration

Azure Repos is the best private cloud-hosted Git Repository

Azure Artifacts to create and share packages across teams

Extensions Marketplace to access various extensions

8. Pivotal Tracker

This tool is perfect for a Certified Scrum Product Owner to do Agile planning and reporting as per the Product Strategy. It has features to plan, iterate, and prioritize team activities in real-time. The Scrum Master can use this tool to perform Sprint Planning and prioritize tasks using the tool’s simple drag-and-drop interface.

9. Bugzilla

Bugzilla Software Tool's flexible workflow engine makes workflow customization easier for the Scrum Master. It allows the project managers to design and integrate different workflows for Scrum, Development, and Testing teams.

10. VersionOne

This web-based project management tool is perfect for committing to Agile Transformation. Software Developers, testers, and other teams can use this software to track and manage their software testing and integration efforts from a single place. As this tool supports most Agile Methodologies, it supports all project management activities, including Product Backlog clearing, Daily Scrum, Project Planning, and Product Delivery.

Summing Up: Evaluate With Agile Tool Your Team Needs

Before selecting an Agile tool, it’s crucial to evaluate business areas where Agile methodologies can be implemented. Also, confirm if the Software Tool offers these standard features:

Dashboard/platform to improve team collaboration and communication.

Cloud-based Data Storage to store and manage project data.

Reporting and Analytics Tools to create and manage audit reports.

Agile Practitioners can also improve their Agile and Scrum knowledge with continuous Learning opportunities from PremierAgile. It will help them choose the right Software Tools for the project’s Agile journey.
